Extra-Creamy Cacio e Uova with Grated Egg

This Roman-inspired pasta dish gets its creaminess from eggs and cheese, creating a luxurious sauce without cream.

Prep Time: 10 minutes Cook Time: 15 minutes Total Time: 25 minutes Serves: 4

Ingredients

  • 1 pound spaghetti or tonnarelli pasta
  • 6 large eggs
  • 1 1/2 cups freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese, plus more for serving
  • 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese
  • 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more for serving
  • 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
  • Kosher salt

Instructions

  1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to package directions until al dente, about 10-12 minutes.
  2. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, Pecorino Romano, Parmigiano-Reggiano, and black pepper until well combined.
  3. Reserve 1 cup of the pasta cooking water, then drain the pasta.
  4. Immediately add the hot pasta to the egg mixture, tossing vigorously with tongs for 2-3 minutes until the eggs cook gently and create a creamy sauce.
  5. Add the olive oil and gradually add the reserved pasta water, a little at a time, until you reach the desired consistency.
  6. Serve immediately with additional grated cheese and black pepper.
